column1: The '''Sketch of the Mythology''' is the 'first' version of [[The Silmarillion]]
Originally written as an outline to explain the background to the alliterative '[[Children of Hurin|The Children of Hurin]]' to Tolkien's old tutor and friend [[R.W. Reynolds]]
column2: it later became the basis from which all work on the [[Legendarium]] derived.
the narrative in the Sketch advances a great deal from ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part One]]''
column3: approaching the final form in most respects
column4: albeit extremely condensed. It was superseded by the [[Quenta Noldorinwa]] in 1930.
